website_summaries.verdict: Offers features that make it the most reliable model on the market – if you need a pump you can rely on to run whenever you need it, this is the one to get.
pros: A dependable sump pump by a trusted name in the industry capable of removing up to 3,300 gallons per hour with its 1/2-horsepower motor
Battery back-up system provides continual operation in power outages
cons: Expensive, but you get a top-performing pump and peace of mind with the price
Some reports of malfunctions, but many more satisfied customers

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect, there are alternative batteries to the Wayne battery.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect. I learned a few things. 1) you have to use a check valve for both the main and the backup pumps (kind of a no duh when you think about it). Attached picture shows the installation of the pumps. 2) there are alternatives to the Wayne battery. I was very concerned about what battery to use. The Wayne battery is expensive and I had seen in other forums that you just need a deep cycle marine battery. I found a Duracell SL127MDC at batteries plus that fit and works just fine - i think it was about $89.
customer_reviews.author: T. O'Keefe

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work when you really need it!
customer_reviews.text: Update: the battery tender for this has a gauge that shows the battery state. It always showed full green which means it’s good. It wasn’t good. They had me do testing to verify this. Very poorly made and not user friendly for monitoring the battery status. You’re better off using a tecmate optimate battery tender for $40 that’s much more functional for maintaining the battery. The one and only time this was needed and the pump won’t run. Total piece of garbage! Extremely disappointed with this product and the company for selling non functional products.
customer_reviews.author: Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Priceless addition
customer_reviews.text: Hoped it wouldn’t be necessary, but after a spring power outage that lasted over 12 hours with a sump pump that empties twice a minute during the wet season...this was awesome to have. After 12 hours we still had full battery charge!!! A little google and review reading made installation a pretty easy process
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M Gee Cram

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Delivered next day! In good condition. Works as well as reviews said it does. Installed easily. I can't believe how fast this thing pumps water from 11 inches in a 15 gallon sump down to 5 inches in less than 2 seconds! It jiggles when it first turns on, but noise is almost non existent. Very quiet. Some reviews say you should have a marine battery, but it is not necessary. So far, I love it. My sump installer recommended Wayne. I don't think you can go wrong with this product.
customer_reviews.author: BobWJ

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work when I needed it to work
customer_reviews.text: The battery indicator or the battery charger doesn't work properly. I've had this for 2 1/2 years and when the power went out, the indicator was green stating a fully charged battery. However, when the water level rose to trigger the pump, it wouldn't pump and the indicator went to red.
customer_reviews.author: kc

customer_reviews.title: 2 years, 3 outages, pump never has worked.
customer_reviews.text: 3 power outages in 2 years and this backup pump has never worked. We. An get it working when we test it, but when the power goes, it fails. It says it's fully charged, there's no indication that it should fail & still, every power outage we have to borrow a generator so our basement doesn't flood. I've contacted Wayne & will update with their customer service.
customer_reviews.author: KellBell

customer_reviews.title: easy to get up and going
customer_reviews.text: I like this pump, my old pump became clogged with debris, and basement flooded- the old pump was a zoeller, while good product, just very loud with the water hammer from check valve, and messy because of the drain under sump lid, this wayne fixes that, is very quiet, backup system is relatively easy to set up- made in the usa too!
customer_reviews.author: JCrain

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you measure basin for width before purchase.
customer_reviews.text: This pump is excellent. Length of carry for water from sump is 8 feet in basement through ceiling to discharge pipe. Lost power for 10-12 hours last night and the pump cycled every 45-60 seconds. The charge was still green on battery this morning. This product saved my basement from flooding. 100%. Make sure you measure basin for this pump. It doesn't sit on bottom of mine like old single pump did. Still works properly but I should have measured.. highly recommend. It also came with check valve which I didn't expect.
customer_reviews.author: Roy C

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great backup sump pump
customer_reviews.text: I got this to install as a battery-powered backup sump pump, in case we ever loose power to the main pump (which happened last week). Easy to install, no way to mess up the electrical connectors, and it has plenty of cable to the pump. About the only fault is the power supply. It is a large, heavy wall wart, and I think it would be easy for it to work its way out of the wall plug. Perhaps a different power supply with a lead-in cable would be better to ensure it stays connected.
customer_reviews.author: pacaBill

customer_reviews.title: Silent Performer
customer_reviews.text: I installed this assembly to replace a single zoeller pump that had worked great for many years but did not have a battery backup. The entire assembly went together fairly easy after carefully dry fitting the replacement plumbing and obtaining a deep cycle battery. I am amazed by how quiet this pump runs! The zoeller sounded like a freight train by comparison. I tested the secondary pump by unplugging the primary pump and the battery charger. It worked just fine. With a 5 year warranty, time will tell if this setup endures but, as of right now I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Long Bow

customer_reviews.title: Better output than the pump it replaced.
customer_reviews.text: My previous (somewhat ancient) back-up sump pump was rated at only 1/12 HP. Throughput was only about 1,000 GPH. This one is rated for slightly more than one-and-a-half times that. Also, the fixed-location trigger-switch is much better than having to deal with two free-floating "floats" (or bulbs) which might might interfere with each other or trigger a pump in the wrong sequence. However, the previous backup pump lasted for 20 years. Let's hope this one is equally good.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Soldier

customer_reviews.title: Charging system fries recommended 75 amp hr batteries with in a week
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and installed this system in my basement a day later I could smell something. Walked up to the DC power pack and it was so hot that I couldn't touch it. Took the recommended battery out put it on a battery tester...fried. Went bought another recommended 75 amp hr deep cell maintenance free battery thinking it was the battery. 2 days later dc power source was hot...battery fried. Spend the money and by a Zoeller system their charging system is state of the art compared to this one. This seems to be a common problem for this system and Wayne doesn't seem to care. Going to try putting a battery tender on the battery. Buy a different product!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Solid pump, works great
customer_reviews.text: I've had the pump in for a month or so and it runs about the same as the old one did when it rains enough. It fit my well fine (standard size well), and the having the peace of mind with the battery-backup pump is worth the cost. We live in the country with overhead power and have had one power outage so far when a tree fell on a line. The pump did exactly what it's supposed to do and we never worried about our basement flooding. I recommend this if you have frequent power outages!
customer_reviews.author: W. Whicker

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with this quiet Pump system
customer_reviews.text: I got the package two days after I ordered. It took only about one hour at most to remove old and install new one. My observations are: 1. It is very quiet when the pump starts and stops. 2. Battery is not included. Any installer will need a 1.5" plastic pipe to glue to the pump connector and rubber connector to existing house piping. 3. I measured the float in my case, pump activates when water level is 9", stops when water lever is 4.75". 4. My pump well diameter is 16", it fits in easily. 5. I tested battery back up pump by cutting off main pump power, it worked very quietly too.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Wen

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service.
customer_reviews.text: The pump did not work immediately after installation. I contacted Wayne and they said they would ship a new one out to me. I waited one week and contacted them again. They did not have one in stock and were waiting on parts to “build one” so they could ship one out to me. I waited another two weeks and still have not received a replacement. I believe I am getting the run-around. I will be contacting Amazon to see if they can help. I cannot believe that there is not a pump available somewhere so they can replace mine. Pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great value and good product.
customer_reviews.text: Brought this product for removing ground water from a basement crawlspace. The product is easy to install and it does come with a check valve. All you need is a 12 volt battery which I got from Walmart for $80.00 and a 22/18/22 sump basin and your in business. The price of the system is great with and addition $110 for a battery and basin we spend under $600 to complete the system. I recommend this product highly.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great backup pump
customer_reviews.text: I have installed The esp25 backup pump. It was an easy install, then I filled the sump with water, and was amazed how fast it pumped the water out. Previously i had the basement watchdog pump and this wayne pump works great, it made the other pump look like a piece of junk. This is a great product, and i would recommend it to anyone who wants a backup...
customer_reviews.author: Bob Perzo

customer_reviews.title: Didn't end up needing it
customer_reviews.text: The plumber told me this was the best sump pump backup. I'm taking his word on it. In the end I actually returned this because my old back up pump was just unplugged and not actually broken like I had thought. Next time I need a new one I will probably order this again, hopefully that's a few years away!
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: All in one Unit
customer_reviews.text: My sump pump pit is standard size. The pump barely fits. I had a hard time inserting the provided coupler on to the pump outlet. I contacted the customer service, and they said it is OK to hammer it down and they will replace the part if it breaks. Customer service is responsive. It has been about a month since I installed, so I cannot comment on reliability yet. But the pump seems to be a good product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What I needed
customer_reviews.text: I needed a redundant sump system for my home. Simple drop in replacement for existing electric only sump pump, had to cut 2” off existing pvc. Very quite as compared to older pump. I put 115AH deep cycle battery on it. Installed 31 March 2020, we’re in the rainy season now in sw Ohio all is well in late may early June.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon W.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, quiet, 1 year old so can't yet comment on reliability.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a battery backup for our sump pump and the main pump was getting pretty old. This was very simple to install and so far has worked well. WE have not had any power outages, so I've only tested the backup by manually operating the switch. It's only a year old so I can't yet speak to the long term reliability. Note that you'll need to purchase a 12v deep cycle battery so budget approximately $100-$150 extra for that.
customer_reviews.author: sean taylor

customer_reviews.title: Just like another guy here mine arrived with the primary pump ...
customer_reviews.text: Just like another guy here mine arrived with the primary pump DOA. The 12 V backup works fine and pretty quiet. Wasted time and money to replace an original Zoeller with no backup. Now I'll have to put the original back and get another brand, most likely a Zoeller with backup which I was told is the Cadillac of sump pumps. Hate this kind of hassle being pretty heavy stuff to ship back and forth....not sure how this model has such good reviews if they ship dead units...
customer_reviews.author: vasile jurge

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy Install, Great Unit!
customer_reviews.text: This has already paid for itself 3 times over during power outages at my house. The peace of mind it gives me to know I wont wake up with a wet basement after heavy rainfall is wonderful! The install takes little to no time at all, and it works great right out of the box (after you add the batteries)
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: It was relatively easy to install if you are comfortable with PVC piping
customer_reviews.text: The pump arrived on time, thanks Amazon. It was relatively easy to install if you are comfortable with PVC piping. If you're not then look up some YouTube videos. Pretty easy. Don't use a flexible pipe, it will leak eventually. Had an issue with the backup circuitry and Wayne sent me a replacement in just a few days, GREAT service. As for functionality. Power has gone out twice since install and it flipped over to the battery and worked flawlessly for several hours. Excellent piece of mind. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: N. Valente

customer_reviews.title: No longevity!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this installed since the end of August. The pump has not had to run too much, but now it is March and snow is melting and the pump's switch has already malfunctioned. I am not impressed with the longevity of this product. This isn't the first time a Wayne pump has crapped out after a short period of time. We are very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Harming

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and quick
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit to replace a similar Basement Watchdog that barely outlasted its warranty. This unit was simple to install and required very little modification to the existing connections. The wiring in particular is less complicated than other systems. In operation the unit is incredibly quiet - you'd have to be very near it to know it's running. I've owned sump pumps for 30+ years and have never encountered one this quiet. It's also quite efficient and clears the sump quickly. The second pump with battery backup offers some peace of mind in case of power failures. All in all, this is a great find.
customer_reviews.author: Kronosman

customer_reviews.title: Overall both primary and back up work great.
customer_reviews.text: The installation was simple. Pull out old one and new one's right in. Lost power about a week ago and had to pail water out of sump hole so it would not over flow for 12 hours I will never do that again with this puppy. Peace of mind. It's worth twice the price. Only issue was no weep hole waiting on wayne to reply on why no weep hole.
customer_reviews.author: Smooth

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pump System/Amazingly Quiet...
customer_reviews.text: Wow, so far this sump pump system is awesome. We have only used it for a couple of days in a mock-up setup, for now, to pump water out of our new poured foundation/basement, but it is so quiet. I was standing right next to it in the basement area and plugged it in, and couldn't hear the pump working at all. I thought it wasn't on, but it was pumping water great. Excellent pump so far. I hope the quality of it is as good as advertised because so far I really like this.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gaines

customer_reviews.title: Solid setup...great value
customer_reviews.text: One of the easiest systems to install. Super quiet. I looked all over for a backup system and hands down, for the money, you’ll be hard pressed to find a better one. I ordered the AGM Wayne battery and I test it about every two weeks by unplugging the AC pump and letting the DC pump take over. If I had one suggestion, it would be to have an alarm that does not reset until the user does it manually. Or at least provide that option for homeowners. Once the water level goes down the audible alarm shuts off leaving no indication that the battery backup was on.
customer_reviews.author: Bob and Tonia

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Easy Installation
customer_reviews.text: The Wayne ESP25 Backup Sump Pump system was super easy to install if you're somewhat handy around the house. And, excellent value purchasing through Amazon compared to other retailers. My old primary sump pump was in good shape, so all I had to do was connect the backup pump to the existing 1.5" PVC pipe. The electrical connections were simple. I used a marine deep-cycle battery that I purchased from Autozone and a check valve that I purchased from Home Depot. Great system so far!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Performed When Needed
customer_reviews.text: Had a plumber install this about 18 months ago. I had yet to actually "need" it until now. I manually ran it every couple months to move things around, but for the most part it sat there doing nothing. Strong storms lost power for ~4 hours. Pump kicked on probably 30 times and was still on green battery, so no doubt it could have gone for a while. Worked like a charm. Didnt need to haul out the generator. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Coop

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and super quiet
customer_reviews.text: Easy install, super quiet. I ordered this and the Wayne 75ah battery and also decided to replace my check valve with a quiet clear check valve. I replaced a 14 year old still working liberty pump and basic check valve which was not quiet at all. Now when the Wayne runs you don't even know it's going which is awesome. Highly recommend this
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wolford

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and great performance
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Directions could use some improvement and explaining some some details. Yes it was easy to install but it was unclear if a check valve was required (installed one) since a check valve must exist on the base to prevent one pump from pushing water to the other. Did not see this explanation in the directions. The brick for a plug is really big and heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Borski

customer_reviews.title: Recommend 100%
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this last year, but didn't feel the need to write a review until we lost power for 2+ days recently. The pump worked perfectly, our basement stayed dry (our neighbor's did not). When power is out, there is an audible alarm. Not quiet, but not blaring either. You can hear it from one floor away, but not two. During operation, the pump is very quiet. We can only hear the noise of water flowing through the pipe when it operates.
customer_reviews.author: SMA

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this system. I wish the wires were kept in some sort of spiralized cord management, but a couple dozen zip ties took care of this. The float for the main pump is located near the edge of the unit so make sure it's well clear of the basin wall. Otherwise, this system when coupled with the pumpspy wifi notification system. Both pumps are VERY quiet and the check valves are nice.
customer_reviews.author: T. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: This is the most disappointing product I've ever bought
customer_reviews.text: I regret buying this. I bought it for the peace of mind. If I lose power in a rare deluge of rain, I could have a structure damaged. So I bought this, and it has failed 3 times in less than a year (bought 10/15). First it was something in the circuit board. A couple months later is was the darn transformer cable. Who ever heard of those going bad? Finally, it looks like the battery died in less than a year. Of course, each time, that alarm that can't be turned off without unbolting the battery goes off, always in the middle of the night. I hate this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great investment.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a WAYNE ESP25 back up sump pump and the Mighty Max battery exactly 2 years ago. The real test was yesterday when I lost power and rained for 2 days. The pump and battery performed excellent for the 24 hours I had no power. The pump started every 2 minutes. I was worried about the battery, but after 24 hours of pumping approximately every 2 minutes the charging indicator for battery was still on the green. I am very happy with the battery and the pump.
customer_reviews.author: Cioaca

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these as a "just in case" and my "just in case" incident came about 3 weeks after I installed them. We had non-stop rain for 1 week combined with a power outage. Water was flowing into my sumps like a wide open water faucet. These had no problem keeping up, even with an 8 foot lift to my ceiling. The only downside is that batteries are rather expensive. All said an done, to install 2 of these with batteries was close to $1000 CAD. Sure beats hauling water buckets though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wayne pump
customer_reviews.text: To assure battery operation press test button monthly. I do not utilize included charger instead use Stanley branded maintainer. This pump as any other submersible pump will need to be periodically cleaned and maintained if used in hi mineral content ground water. Overall a great system.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need to purchase the deep cycle battery in addition
customer_reviews.text: Well built and quieter than the pump I replaced. I think this is a case of "you get what you pay for." Quality is not cheap. But you need to spend about $100 for a deep cycle battery. I get a good one and not a cheap one. I got a dura cell.
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: very easy to install. Pump don't fail me now!
customer_reviews.text: Flooded about two years ago, lost power for four hrs. Complete nightmare and still hesitated to install battery back up till today. Pump assembly Was very easy to install, had no issues. Bought a deep cycle battery at batt plus Gas less gel battery maintenance free $200 additional cost so keep in mind if it's your first batt back up pump assy.. Read several reviews and researched several brands and decided to go with Wayne brand. Primary pump looks similar to my Ridgid HD special, needed to replace before rain season starts. Only time will tell
customer_reviews.author: Gus

customer_reviews.title: Dead in under a year
customer_reviews.text: The regular pump works great. The battery backed pump is already dead. It ran maybe 3 times ever? Noticed it screeching for help when the power went off the other night - good thing I had a UPS handy or we'd have had a flooded basement!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmie Lightner

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Pump
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my existing sump pump with the Wayne WSS30VN to have the battery back up. It was super easy to install (30 minutes) and fit into my 16" basin. Its located in our entertainment room and we can't even hear it run. I also purchased the super quiet check valve and theres no more clunking. Its nice having the battery backup in case power fails. You do have to buy that battery separate.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Hess

customer_reviews.title: I love this sump pump
customer_reviews.text: I love this sump pump. Whisper quiet pump. Easy to install, took me a couple of hours. I need to buy a few pvc fitting and a pvc check valve. It doesn’t include the back-up battery, it does include the battery case and controls. You can save some money by not buying the Wayne brand battery. I purchased a marine deep cycle battery for about half the price and it works just as well
customer_reviews.author: PGS

customer_reviews.title: Installation was very easy and straightforward!
customer_reviews.text: While I've only had this installed for a month or so, it is working great. Installation was very easy and straightforward...having the two pumps preassembled with the necessary check valves made this a breeze to put in place. In testing the backup pump portion, it has significant more power than the old unit that I replaced. It seems very solid and well made, so as long as it lasts, I think this will be a great purchase and insurance against a wet basement, especially when the power goes out.
customer_reviews.author: Brian-B

customer_reviews.title: Very nice unit
customer_reviews.text: Very good, heavy duty sump pump. Easy to install, just drop in the tank with the correct length of PVC, plug it in and you are good to go. The backup attached pump is simple, three connections to the bottom of the battery box cover, plug in to a 110 and that's it. Check valves are installed on both pumps so no need to buy. The directions are pretty useless and it's simple enough that you don't really need them.
customer_reviews.author: rickster

customer_reviews.title: Only Time will Tell.
customer_reviews.text: Could not be easier to install. Just drop it in as long as your previous outlet pipe is reasonably routred. It runs really quiet too. I did have issue with a wire from the transformer. It was pulled out of the connector and the battery would not charge. I pushed it back in temporarily and called Wayne who promptly sent me a new transformer with the wire connected firmly this time. I do wish this had a test button...like the Basement Watch Dog backups. Time will tell how good this thing is.
customer_reviews.author: mikmax1

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, works well
customer_reviews.text: I've never changed my sump pump. I wanted one that was primary and had a battery back up - this works very well. I was able to install it on my own and it wasn't particularly difficult. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Zak

customer_reviews.title: False sense of security
customer_reviews.text: I test this pump every 6 months - with that said - the big green light on top that says "battery fully charged" - I check weekly. Even today - that light is green - but the battery is no good and did not work last night when the power went out :-( Do not trust this pump!!!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Items not what was advertised
customer_reviews.text: You leave too much for guess work. You need to provide all that is needed for installation. Don't leave it for second guessing when going to install the sump pump. Why not just include apackage for all the small parts needed instead of trying ro just make a stab at it, I was very disappointed in the lack of help making sure I had everything I needed to do the job. I could understand the pipe issue but not all the other fittings needed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Swift

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and maintain
customer_reviews.text: I have had this back-up pump since 2013 and it works perfectly. I live out in the country and we have numerous power outages and this has saved my basement from flooding on many occasions. Easy to install and maintain. The pump alerts you when it is kicking on so you know when your main pump is not operating.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Wirick

customer_reviews.title: Great backup.
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a great backup system for my basement sump. We have had multiple power failures and it has worked every time. No getting up in the middle of the night to stat the generator. Fits into my 17" sump hole nicely. Very quiet too.
customer_reviews.author: K. Augustine

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Product
customer_reviews.text: I conducted quite a bit of research before purchasing this sump pump. This one was one of the best on the market for the money. I am very pleased with the performance and would highly recommend this sump pump to anyone who is looking to ensure their basements will not be flooded.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa L.

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it says it will do. Chose ...
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it says it will do. Chose this one over the smaller version because lets face it, no one ever says gee I wish I had the ability to pump less water... We've had the occasion to have it work when the power went out and water was coming into the sump pit and it performed exactly as expected. Price is kinda salty, but to protect a finished space, it was worth it and then some.
customer_reviews.author: MDPA RN

customer_reviews.title: Reliable when the power goes out.
customer_reviews.text: I live in coastal VA, where tropical storm force winds are no longer rare. My basement could easily get swamped in the time between the power going out and the time I get a generator running, so a sump pump with battery backup is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Nazani

customer_reviews.title: Great sump and backup pump system!
customer_reviews.text: Pumps came packaged very well. Installation was straightforward and easy. Prior pump was a Zoeller unit which did last 15 years, but was so loud I could hear it pumping from anywhere in the house. The Wayne Unit is virtually silent---Can't hear it run unless I go to the garage and remove the basin lid. Both primary and backup pumps work perfectly, and they appear to outperform the prior pump in terms of gallons/minute. Time will tell how this holds up, but so far I'm 100% satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: William N.

customer_reviews.title: The pump works fantastic. It pumps quietly and fast
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in June of 2014. The pump works fantastic. It pumps quietly and fast. The battery is big and can pump for a while with no power. The problem that I have with it is that the expensive battery that I bought. (Wayne 75 amp) lasted under 2 seasons. I went to test it this spring and the battery didn't have enough juice to pump out the water in the sump. I contacted Wayne on their website and they have not replied to my email. So product works well, battery needs to be better
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Great unit!
customer_reviews.text: Installed 2 of these for my Mother-in-law. She said they are so quiet she doesn't know if they are working or not but has confidence that they are. She loves them. Enough said.
customer_reviews.author: Scott D

customer_reviews.title: Works well but is covered in rust after 3 moths
customer_reviews.text: This pump set up was easy to install, seems to work well, it is quiet and pumps fast. My concern is that it is only 3 months old and it is covered in rust. The water in the sump is crystal clear but the exposed metal and screws are rusty as well as the painted parts of the motor. Really disappointed with that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent does Come with check valve
customer_reviews.text: I saw a few people said you needed to buy check valves but there is already one on each pump and they gave me one for the line above. So not sure which ones they got this one literally took me 10 minutes to put in and hook up. It is extremely quiet definitely worth it for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Smith

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this item 2 weeks ago. Installation quite straightforward. Electronics [charger, digital readout, etc] very simple. Tested in sump and worked well. Electronics do not indicate if pump has cycled or not, which would be useful as it is a backup. I installed with 100 Ahr battery so that maybe I get more than 10,000 gallons per charge? It has not been used in real-life flooding, so only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Ran for 2-3 hours today every 30 seconds for about 5-7 seconds each cycle while power was out. Never missed a beat and kept our finished basement dry as a bone until the power returned. The battery used is a 75ah Mighty Max. The pump ran flawlessly and the green battery charged light never went out or gave any indication the pump was running the battery down. I know others that have seen 48 hour run times with this pump without issue. This is the second ESP25 I've installed in as many houses. Its well built pump for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Roth

customer_reviews.title: Great back up sump pump
customer_reviews.text: Have not lost power yet but in testing it out, does the job great as a backup pump. I am not using their battery. I decided to try and battery that was $100 cheaper and 25% larger. Fits great. Search for other low cost deep cycle marine batteries on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Bernal

customer_reviews.title: Great pump with backup for novice.
customer_reviews.text: Simple for a novice. Had to clarify because instructions are for products individually..ie: says to drill a hole for air pockets, but it doesn't need it in this kit. Nice to have it pretty much assembled. Note from things I learned: 1) get the rubber connecter for easy access to pumps if needed. 2) put a third check valve somewhere. I had one before that was along the foundation wall right as it goes vertical.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty simple installation. It pumps ALOT of water. I found a battery locally for 100 bucks. My power went out for a few minutes during a storm and the unit ran flawlessly. Hopefully it lasts a long time and I end up not needing it. But more realistically it'll get a lot of use. I'll probably install one in my second pit as well. Can't be too safe.
customer_reviews.author: RabidBeagle

customer_reviews.title: Not Sure on This One
customer_reviews.text: First off, i have an 18" dia basin, and it barely fits without the float catching in the side. Also, when i tested the battery pump, it barely sucked out any water, before it shut off. Not feeling too confident yet. The install was fairly easy, only because i watched a youtube video. The instruction book that came with the pump is terrible
customer_reviews.author: jdeck

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, primary pump is built solidly. System does come with battery case and charging system, no need to purchase separate charger or case....very good value for price. Tips: 1) To verify primary pump is operational and not damaged during shipping, pump must be plugged in AND float must be engaged to the ON position (up). Cons: 1) Instruction manuals, as previously noted by others, they are lacking and can be a bit confusing initially with 2 different sets (primary & backup)...not the combined system. But again, easy to install so unless you are clueless the average handyman can get this done easily.
customer_reviews.author: chino1978

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to supplement my standard sump pump. Design is compact enough that I had no problem fitting it in the sump pit with my 120 volt sump pump. Had seen the Guard Dog at Menards but, this one is rated for more cfm water flow. Found out for a battery that the one sold at Menards as Campbell Housfield is the same as the Wayne battery. Same part number and warrantied by Wayne. Have figured out after researching batteries that Marine batteries do not hold up as long as ones specifically designed for this kind of use. Electric golf cart and RV batteries do hold up good also but, good ones of them a very pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Carter

customer_reviews.title: Great Sump Pump
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, good power, tested backup pump but hasn't needed to use it yet. Very quite sump pump compared to my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Flash 35

customer_reviews.title: Good, can be improved ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product, installation instructions can be improved on to help Do It Yourself users. Phone and email guidance when company was contacted for tips was very good. Gave 4-stars as there is no On/Off switch on the circuit board to simulate power-outage test periodically. One has to unplug the power cord from the wall to test battery backup sump motor every time you wish to. This was my first experience with sump pumps and after watching some youtube videos on the subject as preparation, I was able to do this in a day with couple of trips to home depot to get the required materials. Been just a month so I cannot give more feedback at this stage.
customer_reviews.author: Gangadhar B. Vellanki

customer_reviews.title: Do it. Buy it. Buy it now.
customer_reviews.text: After the old pump failed and the basement was under siege. I went to the depot and grabbed any pump I could find to hold the floods at bay. Did a lil research and found this beauty. Returned the depot pump and installed Mr Wayne here. Honestly, i can't hear this thing run. It's like a whisper. Ya get the pump and backup pump combo as a unit. For one low price! How can you beat this? You can't. Feel free to purchase this and you won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. We've had this about 6 months now
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. We've had this about 6 months now, and it made it through a very rainy spring and summer. Pros: Very powerful. Love the battery backup. Easy setup. Check valves build in already (although we added another ourselves just to be safe). Battery comes on everytime its needed. Cons: Can be a bit loud. Battery is sold separately and is definitely NOT cheap. But worth it for the peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: zjmoore1

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install without having a pay the handyman to ...
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install without having a pay the handyman to come and install. Had heavy rains past few days and the primary pump has been pumping water as expected. It is the quitest pump we had installed so far. It was hard for me to switch from zoeller to Wayne but I am happy to make the switch
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: quiet, well designed, efficient pump.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two of these now(for old home and current home), and the first went in as designed and has been working fine for a couple of months. It's quiet, very efficient, and the backup works very well too. The second one, I installed without testing and the primary failed to work. To their credit, Wayne sent me a replacement primary immediately, so the customer service is good as well. I just wish I didn't have to cut my pvc again to get it out.
customer_reviews.author: Cbass

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Great item and it was easy to install. It quickly and quietly removes water. Having the battery backup and secondary pump is a piece of mind and works just as well as the primary. Constructed well and very convenient that it is all one assembly. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: wagonfan

customer_reviews.title: It failed within 15 months and Wayne warranty process is a headache!
customer_reviews.text: Pump is not well built, and debris easily stucks and get sucked in through the bottom. It clogged my system and pump failed. Tried talking with Wayne staff and it was impossible to get the pump checked.
customer_reviews.author: Rick T

customer_reviews.title: The product seems well made and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: The product seems well made and easy to set up. The plug connections are such that you don't need to worry about hooking anything up wrong as the wires can only can be connected one way due to the unique plugs. One thing wrong in the instructions is they say you need to install a check valve but according to their help line you do not and should not. I inquired because separate check valves are visible on both the battery backup and the 110 pump. Also they don't say in the instructions if you should use a conventional or a deep cycle battery. The help line verified it should be a deep cycle.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Dipietro

customer_reviews.title: Mine is loud.
customer_reviews.text: Was easy enough to install and seem to operate fine. However, contrary to the reviews I’ve read mine is EXTREMELY loud when it engages. Spoke with Wayne and they suggested the gray Y fitting was on backwards and there was a check valve inside the valve slamming which was meant for the auxiliary pump. I switched it and it’s still just as loud. It can be heard engaging every minute throughout the entire 3 story house.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Driscoll

customer_reviews.title: Bad switch
customer_reviews.text: This review is right out of the box. Have not had a chance to test the back up pump yet. The main pump is however whisper quiet and plenty of power for my needs. Would be a blown away 5 star review if it weren't for a faulty heavy switch. My problem was solved with a 2 oz.counter weight to make the float heavier to actuate the switch to turn the pump off. Not exactly a major problem but a hassle and an extra worry for a brand new (not cheap) pump. Does Wayne have a better solution for this problem short of a replacement?
customer_reviews.author: Fyasko

customer_reviews.title: great sump pump
customer_reviews.text: Had this unit for more than a year. It is very quiet and backup pump works as advertised. All around well made product. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Aikaterini Varsou

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a review writer so I'll keep this short - it was easy to install (replacing existing pump), much quieter than my older Wayne pump and the backup gives me peace of mind. I did add a "no-clunk" check valve which really helped keep the noise down. I also bought the Wayne battery - which was expensive. Could have saved some money perhaps by shopping around a bit but didn't think it worth the time. Overall I'm very happy with the system.
customer_reviews.author: Fury

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, very quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Agree with other reviews the the instructions are very generic, but since it is pre-assembled there is really not much to it. You need to take a little care to make sure you orient it in the sump hole so the float switch has enough clearance to the sump hole wall. This is the only reason I did not give it a 5 as this seems like something that could be a little better thought out. Very quiet operation and as another reviewer noted....about $500 with the battery but as anyone who has had water in their basement knows, that is a small price to pay.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Basment flooded because we didn't have a battery backup
customer_reviews.text: Everything was fine. The rain was falling, but the sump was keeping up. The basement was dry. Then the power went out. No generator and no battery backup = wet basement. Now we have a generator and a battery backup sump pump. We chose this model because it didn't require a special battery manufactured by the sump manufacturer. The pump was easy to install and came with very good instructions. We haven't had any emergency issues yet, but when I unplugged our normal sump to test this one, it had no problem keeping up.
customer_reviews.author: Illini Fan

customer_reviews.title: Makes Basement Watchdog seem like a toy
customer_reviews.text: After two Basement Watchdogs each died after 3 years while out of town, bought this one for about the same cost. Both pumps much beefier, particularly the battery backup. Minor but easy to overcome complaints that I read about, like electronics inside battery case don’t quite allow case to close over my battery terminal, positive lead loop not quite large enough to fit over my battery terminal, and battery charger too heavy to hang in a wall plug.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: CORROSION !!!  After 31 months!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I live near Skaneateles lake, one of the cleanest lakes in the USA. The groundwater is crystal clear. The pump failed. I emailed customer service and a woman quickly responded. She sent me a Fed Ex paid label to mail the unit to them for repair or replacement. I am hopeful for a resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Albie

customer_reviews.title: Piece of mind achieved & much quieter.
customer_reviews.text: I had a sump failure resulting in about 8" of water in my total basement. I went with this pump for the back up 12v system with alarm. Works well & us much quieter than my Myers pump.
customer_reviews.author: Jls

customer_reviews.title: Great unit, but make sure you have clearence.
customer_reviews.text: Pump is working great. Manually tested the backup a few times and that's also responding well. You definitely need a 15" diameter (or I would say MORE) basin though. I had to get creative. The pump itself is super quiet and the check valve makes minimal noise compared to the THUMP! of the old unit. Overall, I'm very please so long as it continues to work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: everything works as should and quiet
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because I emailed a question to them at WayneCS@sfconsumerbrands.com that's the email to use per their website, and after 6 weeks I still don't have a response.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: easy to install
customer_reviews.text: easy to install, plugged in and had no issues thus far. Take the time to plan out the right plumbing fittings and make sure to add a check valve, otherwise, cheapest flood insurance you can buy especially when a big rain hits while you are out of town
customer_reviews.author: cloneluke

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm in a four day power outage.
customer_reviews.text: This came pre assembled and was easy to put in. I used PVC cement to put a pipe into this. Hooked it up to the Wayne battery, havent had any issues. Worked like a charm in a four day power outage. Note, the battery (not inc) is very heavy, get a friend to help you move and install it.
customer_reviews.author: tjc

customer_reviews.title: Great pump
customer_reviews.text: This thing was a breeze to install. Everything is very user friendly. I purchased a “ Mighty Max Battery 12V 75Ah SLA Battery for Wayne ESP25 Back-Up Pump Brand Product” battery for it and they paired together perfectly. Highly recommend this pump
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Good back-up pump system
customer_reviews.text: Combined this with the WAYNE CDU980E 3/4 HP Submersible primary pump and two Zoehler check valves ( remember you need one for the main and back-up pump). Bought a good 100 Ah deep cycle Everstart battery from Walmart to provide the back-up power. All works very well. Good instructions are included! Do think this system was a bit overprized, but it works quite well.
customer_reviews.author: morris

customer_reviews.title: I should have bought this month's ago.
customer_reviews.text: This sump was a dream to install. Installed with a Wayne sealed battery. Installed with a "no clunk" check valve and it is quiet as a mouse. I replaced a competitive back up sump that was a huge disappointment and the battery needed to be filled with acid. I can not tell you how nice it is not to have to race to the sump every time it rains to make sure it's working. This is one of the best purchases I have made for my house and peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hickman

customer_reviews.title: SUPER quiet pump
customer_reviews.text: SUPER quiet pump! No issues with installation. I only wish the float was adjustable, where the water sits in my basement from a pond near by, I wish I could control the float for when to turn on. Currently It's sitting on about 5.5" of bricks in order to get to the level it should be to not run every 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Hybrid

customer_reviews.title: Great pump.  Very quiet
customer_reviews.text: Pump was easy to install since the backup pump and main pump are all one unit. Very quiet and efficient.
customer_reviews.author: detmemar

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, powerful but bolts are rusting
customer_reviews.text: Had no problems installing this sump pump, it runs quiet and is powerful enough to handle the water during a deluge of rain. After 3 months I lifted the lid of the sump pit, and noticed the bolts on the pump rusting (see photo). Not sure if this will eventually cause the pump to fail. Other than the rust it's a great pump with battery backup in case of a power outage. The manual mentions replacing a switch on the pump every two years; not sure where to get the switch it mentions though.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Crunch

customer_reviews.title: ... Wayne 1/2 HP Battery Backup Sump went in very easily as a drop in replacement for the existing sump ...
customer_reviews.text: The Wayne 1/2 HP Battery Backup Sump went in very easily as a drop in replacement for the existing sump pump. I have a finished basement and wanted the security of knowing that even if the primary failed the secondary would work. I tested both of hte pumps out they both work excellenty. The pump hardly runs on the battery so I imagine you could run several days with no problem. It is much quieter than the last sump pump so sometimes I have to go down to see if it is pumping.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: well built quality unit
customer_reviews.text: the price of this doesn't include the battery, so it isn't an inexpensive solution HOWEVER it seems to be very quality built and i think it will work for a long time. great if you need it or (like me) get a lot of power outages and are worried about a flooded basement.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Dreisbach

customer_reviews.title: We fortunately had not lost power during any storms
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in June 2015 with the hopes of never actually having to use it. Installation was straightforward, and i did at least verify it functioned properly. We fortunately had not lost power during any storms, so for the price I paid, the peace of mind that comes with it was worth the 4 stars. I just cant give it 5 since I've really only verified its initial quality.
customer_reviews.author: TAG

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a great product so far
customer_reviews.text: It seems like a pretty good product. We are on day 1 right now. Install was easy. We’ll see how it holds up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: WAYNE ESP25 12 Volt Battery Back-Up Sump Pump System with Audible Alarm
product_meta.description:
Style:ESP25 battery backup system (old version)| Pattern Name:PumpESP25 is a 12 volt battery back-up sump system with a high flow pump, smart charging technology, audible alarm, and led indicator lights to inform homeowner when the back-up system has been activated and the charge status of the battery.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Wayne reinforced thermoplastic battery backup system pumps up to 3300-gallons per hour. The Reed float switch design will operate the pump with minimal travel area to fit in smaller pits reducing float switch hang ups. The professional grade back-up system keeps the battery properly charged. Comes equipped with an alarm which alerts the homeowner when the back-up system is active. The ESP25 backup sump pump system is designed for easy installation without any major plumbing changes.
